llm.feedback:
The draft lines lack explicit canonical‑handle mapping, magnitude, and causal detail required by the standard.  Re‑write each line to include a handle (e.g., ust10y, spx) with a signed % change, a concise driver/mechanism phrase, a single “what to watch” clause tied to a catalyst window, and a probability backed by a source ID.  For example:  

**Up | Q4 2025 | Fed rate hike slowdown (ust10y –0.5%) | Fed policy meeting in Sept 2025 shows moderate stance (MEZ3P47LC) | 60%**  

**Up | Q1 2026 | DOJ/FTC regulatory relief (spx +0.3%) | DOJ filings in Q1 2026 indicate collaborative approach (HHKTQ3JYH) | 50%**  

**Down | Q4 2025 | Fed real‑rate acceleration (ust10y +0.5%) | Fed policy meeting in Sept 2025 signals tightening (MEZ3P47LC) | 55%**  

**Down | Q2 2026 | Crypto‑payment adoption surge (spx –0.5%) | Global crypto‑payment adoption report in Q2 2026 shows 10% share capture (HHKTQ3JYH) | 45%**  

Ensure each line is a single sentence, uses only IDs present in the source material, and removes any extraneous wording.  This will satisfy the handle‑mapping, catalyst‑window, and probability‑justification criteria.
